results.title: The Compenius Organ in Denmark
results.creator_credit: Christen Jul, Dansk Kulturfilm and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: At Frederiksborg Palace is the famous organ constructed in wood by Esaias Compenius of Brunswick. Kept in working order since 1610, it is a living witness to the love of music which enriched the reign of Christian IV. In the film, the music of Buxtehude (who had considerable influence on J.S. Bach) brings out many of its unique beauties. Tapestries by Hans Kneiper, included in the film, illustrate daily life of the 17th century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christen Jul, Dansk Kulturfilm and Nordisk Films Kompagni

results.title: The Stage to three
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparisons”.
An introduction to three entertainers of outstanding talent: Katina Paxinou, an actress from Greece, Chatuporn Ratanavarah, demon dancer of Thailand, and Bruno Gerussi, a Canadian actor.

group_siblings.title: Four families
group_siblings.creator_credit: Fali Bilimoria, John Buss, Richard Gilbert, William Novic, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Four families
results.creator_credit: Fali Bilimoria, John Buss, Richard Gilbert, William Novic, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparisons”.
An on-the-spot comparison of family life in India, France, Japan and Canada, in which the internationally known author/anthropologist, Dr Margaret Mead, discusses with the film’s writer/director how the upbringing of children contributes to a distinctive national character. Centre of attention in each case is a year-old baby in the family of a farmer of average means. Dr Mead summarises the more typical national characteristics at the conclusion of the film.

results.title: A Company of Men
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Focuses attention on the more delicate question of the prejudices and resistance which may be encountered at all levels when Work Study is introduced into industry. The story is based on the day-to-day record of a six-months period in an engineering firm in the Midlands, and is presented as a realistic account of the difficulties experienced and overcome, in an effort to bring fundamental problems into open discussion.

results.title: Community theatre
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art and Environment”.
The term “community theatre” covers a wide spectrum of groups which reject the normal relationship between audience and actors. They act in factories, schools, at meetings, in the street, performing for people who normally would not go to the theatre.

results.title: Community service
results.brief_description: Film uses two PMG trainee staff as a link to the various activities which take place at the Seventh World Rover Moot at Yarra Brae, Victoria, in January 1962, attended by 1000 rovers from fifteen nations. Countries represented included Sweden, Ceylon, Japan, Papua and Canada. The painted tents of the Canadians depict how they travelled to the moot to join in the many tasks, games, tours and service activities undertaken during the fortnight. The spontaneous songs, the final ceremony and church service shows the fun of rover scout activities and the fine spirit of community service developed.

results.title: Community chest
results.brief_description: A college student reports on the work of the Community Chest movement in the city of Yonkers, USA. The film explains that the Community Chest is a central fund-raising and administrative organization through which various social welfare agencies receive funds according to their needs. Finance for the Community Chest is obtained from a yearly drive among all sections of the community. In this way individual agencies are relieved of the work of fund-raising, thus enabling them to concentrate on their welfare activities.

results.title: Communities
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Ecology Series”.
Reveals the structure and composition of a rain forest. Displays a myriad of populations living in conjunction with one another as the “rain forest community”. Examines the way the community functions, the factors that cause change, and the way all life is tied to the community structure.

results.title: Communism
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Traces the origin and development of Communism, covering the early doctrines of Karl Marx, the roles of Lenin, Trotsky and Stalin and the more recent growth international Communism. Shows how the Western nations are combating the spread of Communism in under-developed countries by supplying food, clothing and industrial machinery and by forming military defence alliances. Typical of Cold War propaganda films in the 50’s, attempts to justify US defence strategies and spending.
